header.summary: Guides students and professionals in inner and personal development.

description: Taught the Srimad Bhagavad Gita (HSS F334), Comparative Region (HUM C421), and Reading Course (BITS C382) as an elective course for 18 years.
Emphasized the practical application of teachings in personal and professional life.
Engaged over 100 students each semester in rich discussions on philosophy, ethics, and leadership.
Taught Bhagavad Gita as part of the Diploma Course at Kurukshetra University, enriching students' understanding of its timeless wisdom.
Explored deep philosophical concepts of the Bhagavad Gita, inspiring learners to integrate these teachings into their daily lives.
Providing mentorship to students and professionals from institutions across globe both in person and online.
Also conducting Bhagavad Gita seminar and training sessions in collaboration with universities and industries.

references.name: Dr. Siddarth Bhatia
references.testimonial: Sumit Sir's way of teaching transcends the classroom. He doesn't just explain ideas — he awakens thought. His calm demeanor, depth of knowledge, and ability to simplify even the most abstract concepts have deeply influenced how I think and lead.

references.name: Dr. Gaurang Bansal
references.testimonial: It's rare to meet someone who combines intellectual sharpness with genuine humility the way Sumit Sir does. He shaped not just how I look at texts like the Gita, but how I approach challenges in business and life. His mentorship has been foundational.

references.name: Gaurang Deoghare
references.testimonial: Learning from Sumit Sir was a transformative experience. He doesn't just interpret the Gita — he lives it. His classes taught me not just philosophy, but how to apply it with clarity and purpose in real-world decisions.

references.name: Prof. Saharsh Agarwal
references.testimonial: What makes Sumit Sir special is not just his knowledge, but the way he connects it to each student's journey. His insights continue to guide me — in academia, in leadership, and in life. He teaches you how to think, not what to think.
